In 1956 the words "In God We Trust" was added to our money.
 
 In 1954 the words "Under God" was added to The Pledge of Allegiance.
 
 If this is a Christian nation why did they wait until 1954 and 1956 to add those words?

 In 1954 the words "Under God" was added to The Pledge of Allegiance.
 
 If this is a Christian nation why did they wait until 1954 and 1956 to add those words?

 
 Actually, 1956 was when it went on paper money, it had been on coins since 1864. 
 
 The adoption of these phrases is likely linked to the Cold War, which if you note, was fought against "godless communists". Had to justify ourselves somehow.
